Resume

EDUCATION

General Assembly, Web Development Immersive – Jan. 2015 to April 2015

Three-month intensive program in full-stack Ruby on Rails web development.

Marlboro College, B.A. in Psychology/Philosophy – Sept. 2008 to May 2012

Graduated with High Honors.

TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE

  • Ruby/Ruby on Rails (RSpec, PostgreSQL)
  • JavaScript (jQuery, Angular.js, d3.js, AJAX, Jasmine)
  • HTML5, CSS3, Twitter Bootstrap, Sass

    • PROJECTS

    Non(?)Chan, a Rails imageboard, https://github.com/idelairre/nested_comments

    A Rails implementation of the popular Futaba imageboard and forum software intended to preserve anonymity while giving users the control to manage their posts, create new threads from replies, delete replies, and squelch users.

    Bob’s Bagels, an e-commerce webapp, https://github.com/BagelsByBob

    A JavaScript web app with a backend rails API which allows extensive bagel customization options and the ability for customers to pay via credit card with the stripe API. Group project at General Assembly.

    Critical Exposure, social networking and collaboration software for artists, forthcoming

    Rails backend with image uploading through Amazon S3. Single page Angular.js front end. Features voting and full-featured text editor for comments. The app is intended to be used collaboration tools to allow artists to gain exposure and support for their projects while facilitating a pedagogical and collaborative culture for the study and creation of art.


    PRIMARY EXPERIENCE

    Earley & Associates, Client Services Intern – Sept. 2010 to Aug. 2013

    Organized and managed proposal document database. Created a "best of" portfolio of proposals connected to successful accounts and a new template that combined their best features.

    Melrose Asset Group, Executive Personal Assistant – Sept. 2010 to Sept. 2013

    Personal Assistant for Andrew Celentano (now Sponsorship Chair at Women in Technology International). Managed salesforce accounts and constructed web pages for non-profit clients.


    SECONDARY EXPERIENCE

    LeMatJournal.org, Founder/Webmaster/Contributing Writer – Jan. 2014 to Present

    Created, designed, and maintained website and social media for an independent art journal focusing on aesthetics and critical theory.

    Katama Global Spirits Group, Retail Sales Associate/Web Advisor – Jan. 2013 to Aug. 2013

    Consulted in the early stages of the company's website and social media launch. Assisted in negotiating with distributors and helped run kiosks during tasting events.

    Corridor Company, Inc., Marketing Intern – July 2012 to June 2013

    Composed or edited emails for content and grammar, wrote and revised copy, and performed clerical duties such as mailings.
